Description: Gold chain necklace with an garnet-inlaid pendant; the chain consists of a series of interconnected loops of gold wire arranged in short sections which are linked with single wires with garnet spacer beads in between; at one end of the chain is a pendant comprising a tapering hoop with a garnet, the other is a S-loop clasp attached to which is a conical garnet in a simple bezel; the pendant is an elaborate wheel-like motif with three oval settings in the shape of leaves made from gold sheet, each originally set with stones (one remains), decorated with granulated spirals and beaded wire.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2743)
